intro: Nardosmia japonica, commonly known as Japanese stinkroot, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the plant is bruised or crushed. Nardosmia japonica is often found in moist, shaded areas and is considered a weed in some regions.
